meanings.sent1: She was equalising the distribution of candies among her friends.
meanings.sent2: The teacher was equalising the scores to ensure fairness.
meanings.sent3: The chef was equalising the ingredients in the recipe, making sure each flavor was balanced.
meanings.sent4: The artist was equalising the colors on the canvas, creating a harmonious composition.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic was equalising the pressure in the tires to ensure a smooth ride.

meanings.sent1: He was equalising the surface of the table by sanding it down.
meanings.sent2: The gardener was equalising the soil in the garden for better plant growth.
meanings.sent3: The carpenter was equalising the legs of the chair to prevent wobbling.
meanings.sent4: The athlete was equalising his breathing to maintain a steady pace during the race.
meanings.sent5: The tailor was equalising the hem of the dress to ensure it hung evenly.

meanings.definition: To balance or adjust to make the same
meanings.sent1: The accountant was equalising the budget to allocate funds appropriately.
meanings.sent2: The conductor was equalising the volume of the instruments for a harmonious performance.
meanings.sent3: The baker was equalising the sizes of the cupcakes for a uniform presentation.
meanings.sent4: The coach was equalising the playing time among team members for fair competition.
meanings.sent5: The scientist was equalising the temperature in the experiment to control variables.
